content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>Training</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10672/554" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle>Training Packages</subtitle> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10672/554</id> <updated>2015-03-06T00:48:52Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-06T00:48:52Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Graffiti around University of Edinburgh</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10672/568" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10672/568</id> <updated>2014-06-06T11:30:51Z</updated> <published>2014-06-05T23:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Graffiti around University of Edinburgh This dataset maps the location of anti-social graffiti around the University of Edinburgh\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds central campus.  The data was collected over a 2 week period between the 19th May and the 2nd June 2014.  The data was collected using a smartphone through an app called Fieldtrip GB (http://fieldtripgb.blogs.edina.ac.uk/).  Multiple asset collectors were deployed to use a pre-defined data collection form which allowed users to log the following attributes: Date / Name of asset collector / Type of graffiti (image/tag/words/advert/\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd..) / What the graffiti was on (building/wall/lamppost/\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.) / What medium was used (paint/paper/chalk/\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.) / Density of graffiti / Photograph / Location.  The data is by no means complete and realistically captured only around 50% of the graffiti in the study area.  It is hoped that this dataset will be updated every 3 months to chart the distribution of graffiti over time data  was collected using the app Fieldtrip GB Once collected, data from multiple asset collectors was merged in FtGB\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds authoring tool and exported as a CSV file. This was then imported into QGIS and saved as a vector dataset in ESRI Shapefile format. </summary> <dc:date>2014-06-05T23:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Data Download Exercise</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10672/562" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Carr, Viv</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10672/562</id> <updated>2014-04-10T15:12:53Z</updated> <published>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Data Download Exercise Carr, Viv Zip file with exercises in PDF and PPTX formats, plus trainer guide and Quick Guides for all download services. </summary> <dc:date>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Working with map data in GIS</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10672/561" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Carr, Viv</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10672/561</id> <updated>2014-09-02T14:45:38Z</updated> <published>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Working with map data in GIS Carr, Viv Wind Farms \ufffd\ufffd- follows on from the 'Dave' Data Download case study. View and symbolise OS raster and height data and Wind Farm location data. </summary> <dc:date>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Roam Exercise Set 2</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10672/560" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name>Carr, Viv</name> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10672/560</id> <updated>2014-04-10T15:07:42Z</updated> <published>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Roam Exercise Set 2 Carr, Viv Zip file with 5 Roam exercises in PDF and PPTX formats, plus trainer guide and Quick Guide. </summary> <dc:date>2014-04-09T23:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
